text:
One of the hardest things that i ever
did in my life like in terms of the

sheer amount of willpower
it required was doing a three-day water

fast and i literally tricked myself
into doing it like it wasn't even my

plan to do this thing i only found out
about it two days ago

yet here i am haven't not eaten for the
longest period of time in my entire life

and i like the fact that i'm starving
how did i pull this off

how did i trick myself to like doing
such a hard thing

well it's actually quite simple see
during that period of time in my life

i was getting fat i was traveling around
a lot and i sort of have this obsession

with trying out new foods whenever i go
to a new country

including fast food chains so one day i
ended up

stuffing myself past my limit with
mexican food and i was feeling super

tired and bloated
so i decided to jump on my phone and

browse a subreddit called
r fitness because i felt like i had gone

too far this time
and that i had to start shedding off

some of that belly fat i had accumulated
and by pure chance while scrolling

through the subreddit i came across a
post

showing a before and after picture of
someone who had undergone

a huge transformation in a very short
period of time

it was something like 20 pounds in just
two months i was impressed and intrigued

at the same time how in the world did
this guy do this

so i clicked on the post and started
reading the comments it turns out that

all he did was fast and i'm not talking
about

intermittent fasting or a 24 hour fast
this guy was doing

weekly fast no food just water
for an entire week at a time my initial

thought was
this is crazy is that even safe to do

why would anyone do
this but someone in the comments linked

to another subreddit called
r fasting so i clicked on that and it

turns out there's a huge
community of people who love talking

about fasting
so i decided to sort all of the posts by

top of all time
and i started reading and boy i was

blown away there were countless posts
preaching about all these benefits of

fasting that i had never heard of before
and most of these posts were backing up

their claims with trustworthy studies
oh my god there were so many benefits

apparently it promotes extremely fast
fat loss with barely any muscle loss

it boosts your immune system by
triggering something called a pathogen

it enhances your brain power it
rebalances your gut

it keeps you focused the list goes on
and on and on

and i was hooked hooked on reading about
all these benefits and looking at all

the before and after pictures
of people who had undergone the most

amazing of
transformations i spent the entire day

binge reading about what fasting could
do for me

i remember scrolling through the
subreddit while i was using the bathroom

i remember falling asleep to a
documentary where they talked about all

these elderly people in some
european country who would go to a

special clinic
and fast and it actually helped with

many of the symptoms
for the diseases they were suffering

from i fully immersed myself
in the world of fasting and when i woke

up the next day all of a sudden i was
motivated to do this

thing this thing that i had never even
heard of two days prior

and the next day i started my first
three day

fast i was able to trick myself into
doing something extremely hard

by making it seem like it was the most
important life-changing thing

that i could be doing in the entire
world basically i sold the living crap

out of it to myself
by exposing myself to the things they

promised over and over again
all day long see the thing is if you can

sell yourself on something
if you can convince yourself that doing

this one thing will change your life
you will have essentially tricked

yourself into doing it in fact you will
crave it you won't even have the

patience to wait because you'll want to
start it that

badly you have a hard time meditating
okay

go hang out on the meditation subreddit
and start reading about all the benefits

go binge watch hours of videos on
youtube about the most successful people

in the world
who meditate and why they do it fall

asleep listening to a documentary
talking about how many benefits that

you'll get and how it'll change your
life forever

do this for one to two days non-stop and
i guarantee

you'll be aching to meditate because
you've convinced yourself that it's the

most
important thing that you could be doing

in the entire world
and that's how i trick myself into doing

hard things
now it's important to note that doing

something hard like this and building a
habit are two

different things what i'm teaching you
here is how to generate huge amounts of

motivation
so that you can take action in order to

be consistent you need to learn how to
turn this action

into a habit and you can learn more
about this by checking out my free habit

building course which i will link to in
the description box below

this episode was sponsored by audible in
order to sell yourself on an idea in

order to trick yourself into doing
something hard

you got to expose yourself to the right
pieces of information

and audible is perfect for this because
they allow you to listen to content

while you're busy doing other things at
home

such as your chores cooking and even
working out the world is facing an

unprecedented amount of new challenges
and i know that this can be a source

of stress which is why audible has
launched stories.audible.com

where anyone can stream hundreds of
titles for free

no strings attached use these stories as
a way to keep yourself entertained and

relaxed
on top of that audible has decided to

give his existing members
even more content to enjoy members can

now download
all of the audible monthly originals

which include
guided wellness programs if you want to

take advantage of all these features go
to www.audible.com forward slash

improvement pill or text improvement
pill to 500-500

to get an exclusive 30-day free trial
which includes one free audiobook

and unlimited audible originals
personally i've been getting back into

intermittent fasting
so i've been listening to life in the

fasting lane by jason
fung it's a good book that tells you

about the many benefits of this form of
fasting so if you're interested in that

you can definitely check it out and
besides that guys

stay tuned
you
